text: The House of Braganza-Saxe-Coburg and Gotha is a term used to describe the royal house of the Kingdom of Portugal until the declaration of the republic in 1910. Its name came from King Ferdinand II of Portugal (House of Saxe- Coburg and Gotha-Koh√°ry) and Queen Maria II of Portugal (House of Braganza). ==References== Category:1836 establishments Category:Royal dynasties
title: House of Braganza-Saxe-Coburg and Gotha
